examples: The sky, as if on cue, was overcast.
If the company faces legal trouble, having a friend at court with the judge could make a significant difference in the outcome.
If you're planning anything, tomorrow's the time.
If he wants to write a book, more power to his elbow!
The Council is the Achilles heel of European democracy, if not the black hole.
words.defineEn: used to express one's opinion
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thể hiện ý kiến của một người

words.defineEn: used to introduce a statement to contradict the general belief or used after a negative statement to contradict or add to it
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để giới thiệu một tuyên bố mâu thuẫn với niềm tin chung hoặc được sử dụng sau một tuyên bố phủ định để mâu thuẫn hoặc thêm vào nó

words.defineEn: used when someone gives their personal opinion, emphasizing on the fact that it is their personal view
words.defineVi: được sử dụng khi ai đó đưa ra quan điểm cá nhân của họ, nhấn mạnh vào thực tế rằng đó là quan điểm cá nhân của họ

words.defineEn: used to express indifference toward the options or choices that are offered
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thể hiện sự thờ ơ đối với các tùy chọn hoặc lựa chọn được cung cấp

words.defineEn: an abbreviation that is used in texting to express one's personal opinion about a particular subject
words.defineVi: một từ viết tắt được sử dụng trong văn bản để bày tỏ ý kiến cá nhân của một người về một chủ đề cụ thể

examples: I got the impression that she wasn't happy.
She gives the impression of being very busy.
He had the strong impression that someone was watching him.
We came away with the impression that all was not well with their marriage.
She left me with the impression that she was unhappy.
words.defineEn: an opinion or feeling that one has about someone or something, particularly one formed unconsciously
words.defineVi: một ý kiến hoặc cảm giác mà một người có về ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó, đặc biệt là một hình thành vô thức

words.defineEn: ‌used to express one's opinions in an honest, serious, or truthful way, especially with disappointment
words.defineVi: Được sử dụng để bày tỏ ý kiến của một người một cách trung thực, nghiêm túc hoặc trung thực, đặc biệt là với sự thất vọng

examples: The landlord did not seem inclined to trust me with lodging before seeing the color of my money.
They are inclined to bite on the back of your leg.
But they’re very inclined to agree.
But they’re very inclined to agree.
Customers are inclined to shop at stores with familiar names, and more shoppers mean more sales.
words.defineEn: giving an opinion in a way that is not strong
words.defineVi: đưa ra ý kiến theo cách không mạnh mẽ

examples: So scientists inferred that the auroras were coming from a bunch of thin ripples in the atmosphere.
His mom infers that the noise hurts his ears.
Some researchers have inferred that faulty connections between areas of the brain may be responsible for autism.
And the capability for language can really only be inferred from the fossil record.
And so we can infer that the image of the taotie, with its fangs, horns, and large eyes, was an integral component of early Chinese ceremonial and religious life.
words.defineEn: to reach an opinion or decision based on available evidence and deduction
words.defineVi: để đạt được một ý kiến hoặc quyết định dựa trên bằng chứng có sẵn và khấu trừ

examples: That was an inference that you drew?
But the whole point of this is, now we can make inferences about a difference of means.
So without that proof, paleontologists have to rely on inferences, based on closely related animals for which they do have hard evidence, a technique known as phylogenetic bracketing.
Sometimes, patients are able to put the pieces together by making inferences over time.
They used a technique broadly called Bayesian statistics or Bayesian inference, which is wildly important to modern science.
words.defineEn: a conclusion that is deduced from the existing evidence or known facts
words.defineVi: một kết luận được suy ra từ các bằng chứng hiện có hoặc các sự kiện đã biết

examples: Some blame Germany for the inflexibility of the Schlieffen Plan.
Using that framework, here are five signs of cognitive inflexibility.

People around you may feel like they don't really know you The last sign of psychological inflexibility is envy and bitterness, which is linked to compulsive striving and high social comparisons and dominance.
words.defineEn: the quality of being unable or unwilling to change
words.defineVi: chất lượng của việc không thể hoặc không muốn thay đổi

words.defineEn: in a firm and unchangeable manner
words.defineVi: một cách chắc chắn và không thể thay đổi

words.defineEn: according to one’s own personal opinion
words.defineVi: theo ý kiến cá nhân của mình

words.phonetic: ɪn slæʃ tə wʌn bækslæʃ ɛs aɪ
words.defineEn: according to one’s opinion
words.defineVi: theo ý kiến của một người

words.defineEn: used to express what one thinks or believes, which is not necessarily a fact
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thể hiện những gì một người nghĩ hoặc tin tưởng, mà không nhất thiết phải là một thực tế

examples: Without thinking, Alice interjects.
And I would interject at saying, what else?
(interjecting) DIRTY!
Even there, respectfully, you're interjecting your opinion about her testimony, which is really what the public doesn't like, respectfully.

These consisted in part of 12 local men tasked with determining the innocence of the accused, and helping interject Royal law into local disputes without requiring the King to have direct say in every matter.
words.defineEn: to suddenly interrupt someone with one’s own opinion or remark
words.defineVi: đột nhiên làm gián đoạn ai đó với ý kiến hoặc nhận xét của chính mình

words.defineEn: according to someone's opinion or perception
words.defineVi: theo ý kiến hoặc nhận thức của ai đó

examples: But the campaign and Houthi intransigence have succeeded in transforming the Arab world's poorest country into a humanitarian catastrophe.
words.defineEn: the state or quality of unwillingness to change one's opinion or behavior
words.defineVi: trạng thái hoặc chất lượng không muốn thay đổi ý kiến hoặc hành vi của một người

examples: The judge will have the last word on the divorce agreement.
The judge allowed my claim.
The judge brought his hammer down on the table.
The judge stood firm in her ruling.
People often judge a book by its cover without reading the contents.
words.defineEn: to form a decision or opinion based on what one knows
words.defineVi: để hình thành một quyết định hoặc ý kiến dựa trên những gì một người biết

examples: It's not for me to pass judgement on your behaviour.
Bob persuaded her to go by car, against her better judgement, and she regretted it as soon as she saw the heavy traffic.
I can feel, I can feel your judgement.
Everyone's going to have certain judgements that they are going to think.
But that is that inner judgement in your head.
words.defineEn: an opinion that is formed after thinking carefully
words.defineVi: một ý kiến được hình thành sau khi suy nghĩ cẩn thận

words.phonetic: tə kiːp wʌn bækslæʃ ɛs oʊn kaʊnsəl
words.defineEn: to keep one's opinions, plans, or intentions secret
words.defineVi: để giữ bí mật ý kiến, kế hoạch hoặc ý định của một người

examples: Sometimes these are explicit liberal or conservative political leanings.
It doesn't matter to me what your political leaning is vs. somebody else.
Can we talk about all that, the leaning?
And it’s taking the Kennedy seat, it’s moving the court from basically conservative with some centrist leanings to a really very, very conservative court.
I have nothing but the utmost and deepest respect for people's political leanings and their beliefs.
words.defineEn: a tendency to believe in or favor something
words.defineVi: một xu hướng để tin vào hoặc ủng hộ một cái gì đó

examples: The judge will have the last word on the divorce agreement.
The judge allowed my claim.
The judge brought his hammer down on the table.
The judge stood firm in her ruling.
People often judge a book by its cover without reading the contents.
words.defineEn: someone who possesses the necessary knowledge or ability to form or give an opinion about something or someone
words.defineVi: một người có kiến thức cần thiết hoặc khả năng hình thành hoặc đưa ra ý kiến về một cái gì đó hoặc một ai đó

examples: He leaned forward to take her hand.
Poultry is a lean source of protein and a healthier alternative to red meat.
She leaned back against the wall and closed her eyes.
He opted for lean ground turkey instead of beef for a healthier burger option.
They knew that a lean agreement is better than a fat lawsuit.
words.defineEn: to have a tendency to choose or support something
words.defineVi: để có một xu hướng để lựa chọn hoặc hỗ trợ một cái gì đó

examples: Number 2: lean toward the person that you're speaking with.
As of 2018, genetic research seemed to be leaning toward team broccoli.
It was culture, leaning toward culture, as opposed to economic growth.
We see his white T-shirt through the windshield and here is Travis now leaning toward him.
After a few months, the part that was tilting toward the Sun starts to tilt away, and the part that was leaning away starts to lean toward it.
words.defineEn: to favor something, especially an opinion
words.defineVi: để ủng hộ một cái gì đó, đặc biệt là một ý kiến

examples: But this flatness thing comes out of left field.
Like, it was kinda like out of left field.
Like, if we came left field with it.
Pringles are such a left field concoction of potato chippiness.
So the idea that young blood might help reduce the signs of aging isn't totally out of left field.
words.defineEn: an opinion that is uncommon, unpopular, or strange
words.defineVi: một ý kiến đó là không phổ biến, không phổ biến, hoặc lạ

examples: Over seven hundred Facebook users have already liked the company’s website.
He likes the comfortable seats and big screen at the movie theater.
By the next morning, over twenty of my friends had liked my new profile picture.
Like the commandments written in stone.
Such helps were like drop in the ocean.
words.defineEn: used in a question asking for a description of someone or something
words.defineVi: được sử dụng trong một câu hỏi yêu cầu mô tả về ai đó hoặc cái gì đó

examples: With a balanced diet, regular exercise, and a positive mindset, Alex maintains being up to the mark in terms of his overall well-being.
The tobacco products included a humectant to maintain the moisture content and freshness.
Maintaining a low profile has never been Maggie's strongest suit.
The document must be copied word for word to maintain its legal validity.
Consuming milk can help maintain healthy skin due to the presence of vitamin A.
words.defineEn: to firmly express an opinion or statement as true and valid, although others may disagree
words.defineVi: thể hiện một cách chắc chắn một ý kiến hoặc tuyên bố là đúng và hợp lệ, mặc dù những người khác có thể không đồng ý

words.phonetic: tə meɪk wʌn bækslæʃ ɛs vɔɪs hɜːd
words.defineEn: to ascertain that one's feeling, opinion, point of view, etc. is considered, understood, or has an impact
words.defineVi: để xác định rằng cảm giác, ý kiến, quan điểm, vv được xem xét, hiểu hoặc có tác động

examples: There's no middle ground.
There's no middle ground.
Is there some middle ground here?
Is there some middle ground here?
This is a good middle ground.
words.defineEn: a specific set of opinions, ideas, etc. on which conflicting parties agree; a position that is intermediate
words.defineVi: một tập hợp cụ thể các ý kiến, ý tưởng, v.v. mà các bên xung đột đồng ý; một vị trí trung gian

examples: And I think people misjudge this in Trump.
What we misjudged, at least in my judgment, until almost after the fact, was that Putin had gotten to the point where he had built this kleptocracy.
A student can struggle or be misjudged or mistreated, and still have gifts that exceed what we're teaching them in classrooms.
But it’s not just those with the least skill who misjudge themselves.
words.defineEn: an unfair opinion formed about someone due to wrong assessment or estimation
words.defineVi: một ý kiến không công bằng hình thành về một ai đó do đánh giá hoặc ước tính sai

examples: But those misjudgments don’t happen for the same reason.
It has been a monumental illustration of misjudgment, and it has been a monumental absence of preparing for the second wave.
It has been a monumental illustration of misjudgment, and it has been a monumental absence of preparing for the second wave.
Here is where we made, at least in my judgment, a misjudgment.
words.defineEn: ‌an incorrect or unjust opinion that is formed about someone
words.defineVi: ‌một ý kiến không chính xác hoặc không công bằng được hình thành về ai đó

examples: That one mistake left him thousands of pounds out of pocket.
One mistake and we're back to the drawing board.
He put salt into the sugar bowl by mistake.
The athlete's mistakes during the game put him on the firing line of criticism from fans and media.
The teacher corrected my mistake and explained the correct solution.
words.defineEn: an act or opinion that is wrong
words.defineVi: một hành động hoặc ý kiến đó là sai

examples: When I suggested he was mistaken he got rather hot under the collar.
No, you're mistaken.
Sorry guys, I was mistaken.
He had just read his own mistaken obituary.
and then I'd get mistaken for him.
words.defineEn: wrong in one's judgment, opinion, or belief
words.defineVi: sai trong phán đoán, quan điểm hoặc niềm tin của một người

examples: Well, under King's command, the facility mistakenly shipped live anthrax to other labs.
Most students mistakenly believe the roommate-assignment system is arbitrary.
A lot of people mistakenly think the Starbucks app is about building loyalty or getting flow or interest.
Just in case you mistakenly pronounce it 'potato', they correct you!
He says Democrats mistakenly blame the guns for violence committed by people.
words.defineEn: in a wrong or incorrect manner
words.defineVi: trong một cách sai hoặc không chính xác

examples: Their approach to sports teaching broke the mold.
I melted suet and poured it into molds to create decorative candles for a cozy atmosphere.
Many traditionalists believe that the sporting industry should be predominately for men, and female journalists have endured a lot of criticism for breaking the mold.
Mold is the same way.
The machine pours the mixture into molds.
words.defineEn: to shape or influence the way someone’s character or opinions develop
words.defineVi: để định hình hoặc ảnh hưởng đến cách phát triển tính cách hoặc ý kiến của ai đó

words.defineEn: to be critical of people and tell them what is right and wrong in order to establish one’s superiority
words.defineVi: chỉ trích mọi người và nói cho họ biết điều gì là đúng và sai để thiết lập ưu thế của một người

examples: Drill instructor: Grab the muzzle.
You may have grains of propellant that exit the muzzle faster than the bullet, supersonically.
So, muzzle flash is affected by the cartridge load and the barrel length if you think about it.
But we’ve got to start with muzzle velocity.
But we’ve got to start with muzzle velocity.
words.defineEn: to restrain someone from freely expressing their opinions  in public
words.defineVi: để hạn chế ai đó tự do bày tỏ ý kiến của họ ở nơi công cộng

examples: Put your name here.
The teacher called out our names one by one for attendance.
The machine takes its name from its inventor.
The name rings a bell.
Your name is mud, sonny!
words.defineEn: the reputation that someone has or the opinion that people have about them
words.defineVi: danh tiếng mà ai đó có hoặc ý kiến mà mọi người có về họ

words.defineEn: ‌in a way that deliberately refrains from giving a definitive answer or expressing one's opinion or intentions clearly
words.defineVi: ‌theo cách cố ý không đưa ra câu trả lời dứt khoát hoặc bày tỏ ý kiến hoặc ý định của mình một cách rõ ràng

words.defineEn: used to emphasize a fact, opinion, statement or quality
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nhấn mạnh một thực tế, ý kiến, tuyên bố hoặc chất lượng

words.defineEn: stated in a way that is exactly accurate
words.defineVi: được nêu một cách chính xác

examples: I handed in my notice yesterday.
She noticed a small bird nesting on the roof of her garage.
He noticed a spider crawling up the wall.
Did you notice the way he was looking at you?
She noticed a difference in taste and texture when she switched to unbleached flour in her cookie recipe.
words.defineEn: (usually plural) a short review on a new play, book, film etc., especially one that is written exclusively for a newspaper or magazine
words.defineVi: (thường là số nhiều) một bài phê bình ngắn về một vở kịch, cuốn sách, bộ phim mới, v.v., đặc biệt là bài viết dành riêng cho một tờ báo hoặc tạp chí

examples: They nodded at every platitude about making sacrifices today for a better tomorrow.
That’s not just some empty platitude.
words.defineEn: a statement or advice that is no longer effective or interesting because it has been repeated over and over again
words.defineVi: một tuyên bố hoặc lời khuyên không còn hiệu quả hoặc thú vị bởi vì nó đã được lặp đi lặp lại nhiều lần
